newsitem.title: USA: Retix sees lower revenues in Q4.
newsitem.headline: Retix sees lower revenues in Q4.

text.p: Retix Inc said it expects its fourth quarter revenues to be lower than those of the third quarter, and of the year-ago fourth quarter.

It also said it expects to report a fourth quarter loss "in line with prior quarters of 1996." The company has reported losses of $1 million to $1.5 million in the year's prior three quarters. It reported sales of $8.2 million in the 1996 third quarter and $7.6 million in the year-ago fourth quarter.

Retix, which provides data networking products for telecommunications carriers, said the revenue decline came mainly from its Vertel subsidiary, where revenues are expected to be about five percent lower than in the year-ago fourth quarter. Vertel provides network management software.
Retix said the impact of the lower sales on earnings is expected to be partly offset by narrowing losses in its Retix Network Systems and Wireless businesses.
